turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about VMFA-351.
turn.1: What was the decommissioning of the F4U Corsair and the 509th Airlift Squadron?
turn.2: During the Korean War the squadron was reduced to paper strength as its pilots and groundcrew were transferred to other units to bring them up to strength.
turn.3: When did the unit return to service?
turn.4: The squadron was able to resume operation in July 1951 after receiving new personnel.
turn.5: What is the most interesting fact about the return to service?
turn.6: VMF-351 was redesignated Marine Attack Squadron 351 (VMA-351) in 1958 after they were re-equipped with the AD-4 Skyraider.
turn.7: Did the unit stay in that role?
turn.8: This lasted until 1962 when they transitioned aircraft to the FJ-4 Fury and once again became VMF-351.
turn.9: What did the unit do after the transition?
turn.10: In 1965 they transitioned from the FJ Fury to the F-8 Crusader.
turn.11: Did they operate the F8 Crusader?
turn.12: They shared their aircraft with Naval Reserve squadrons VF-672 and VF-673.
